title: utap
text: lobstr package provides abstract syntax tree function, like use creating function trees. example, tree select_by_class(): function can demonstrated using data test helpers tests/testthat/helper.R
code: lobstr::ast(   select_by_class(     select_column_class(       col_class()      )   ) ) █─select_by_class  └─█─select_column_class    └─█─col_class # load testthat helpers pkgload::load_all(helpers = TRUE) test_data <- tibble::tibble(   list_var = list(     fct_vec = fct_maker(size = 3),     ord_vec = ord_maker(size = 3),     chr_vec = chr_maker(size = 3),     log_vec = log_maker(size = 3),     int_vec = int_maker(size = 3),     dbl_vec = dbl_maker(size = 3)   ),   log_var = log_maker(size = 6, missing = TRUE),   int_var = int_maker(size = 6, missing = TRUE),   dbl_var = dbl_maker(size = 6, missing = TRUE),   facet_var = facet_maker(     facet_type = "fct",     lvls = 4, missing = TRUE,     size = 6   ),   bin_var = bin_maker(     bin_type = "log",     missing = TRUE, size = 6   ) ) test_data  [38;5;246m# A tibble: 6 × 6 [39m        list_var     log_var int_var dbl_var facet_var bin_var         [3m [38;5;246m<named list> [39m [23m  [3m [38;5;246m<lgl> [39m [23m      [3m [38;5;246m<int> [39m [23m    [3m [38;5;246m<dbl> [39m [23m  [3m [38;5;246m<fct> [39m [23m      [3m [38;5;246m<lgl> [39m [23m         [38;5;250m1 [39m  [38;5;246m<fct [3]> [39m    TRUE          1     0.1 group 1   TRUE          [38;5;250m2 [39m  [38;5;246m<ord [3]> [39m    FALSE       135     3   group 2   FALSE         [38;5;250m3 [39m  [38;5;246m<chr [3]> [39m     [31mNA [39m          269     [31mNA [39m   group 3    [31mNA [39m            [38;5;250m4 [39m  [38;5;246m<lgl [3]> [39m    TRUE        403     0.1 group 4   TRUE          [38;5;250m5 [39m  [38;5;246m<int [3]> [39m    FALSE         [31mNA [39m     3    [31mNA [39m        FALSE         [38;5;250m6 [39m  [38;5;246m<dbl [3]> [39m     [31mNA [39m            1     [31mNA [39m   group 1    [31mNA [39m

title: utap
text: select_column_class() col_class() called within select_by_class(), wrapper function includes return_tbl argument returning columns named vector.
code: lobstr::ast(   select_by_class(     select_column_class( # nested       col_class() # not defined in roxygen2     )   ) )  [38;5;214m█ [39m─ [1m [35mselect_by_class [39m [22m       └─ [38;5;214m█ [39m─ [1m [35mselect_column_class [39m [22m         └─ [38;5;214m█ [39m─ [1m [35mcol_class [39m [22m select_by_class(   df = test_data,   class = c("int", "dbl"),   return_tbl = TRUE )  select_by_class(   df = test_data,   class = c("int", "dbl"),   return_tbl = FALSE )  [38;5;246m# A tibble: 6 × 2 [39m        int_var dbl_var           [3m [38;5;246m<int> [39m [23m    [3m [38;5;246m<dbl> [39m [23m       [38;5;250m1 [39m       1     0.1       [38;5;250m2 [39m     135     3         [38;5;250m3 [39m     269     [31mNA [39m         [38;5;250m4 [39m     403     0.1       [38;5;250m5 [39m       [31mNA [39m     3         [38;5;250m6 [39m       1     [31mNA [39m int_var   dbl_var       "int_var" "dbl_var"

title: utap
text: pull_[type]_cols() functions use select_by_class() return initial set column names.
code: lobstr::ast(   select_by_class(     select_column_class(       col_class()     ),     pull_binary_cols(),     pull_facet_cols(),     pull_cat_cols(),     pull_numeric_cols()   ) ) █─select_by_class  ├─█─select_column_class  │ └─█─col_class  ├─█─pull_binary_cols  ├─█─pull_facet_cols  ├─█─pull_cat_cols  └─█─pull_numeric_cols

title: utap
code: lobstr::ast(   pull_binary_cols(     check_binary_vec(       check_log_binary(),       check_int_binary(),       check_fct_binary()     ),     make_binary_vec()   ) ) █─pull_binary_cols  ├─█─check_binary_vec  │ ├─█─check_log_binary  │ ├─█─check_int_binary  │ └─█─check_fct_binary  └─█─make_binary_vec pull_binary_cols(df = test_data) log_var   bin_var       "log_var" "bin_var"

title: utap
code: lobstr::ast(   pull_facet_cols(     check_facet_vec(       check_chr_facet(),       check_fct_facet()     ),     make_facet_vec()   ) ) █─pull_facet_cols  ├─█─check_facet_vec  │ ├─█─check_chr_facet  │ └─█─check_fct_facet  └─█─make_facet_vec pull_facet_cols(df = test_data) facet_var       "facet_var"

title: Authors and Citation
text: Martin Frigaard. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Frigaard M (2024). utap: Unit Test Shiny App Package. R package version 0.1.0, https://mjfrigaard.github.io/utap/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {utap: Unit Test Your Shiny App Package},   author = {Martin Frigaard},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://mjfrigaard.github.io/utap/}, }

what: Unit Test Your Shiny App Package
title: Unit Test Your Shiny App Package
text: goal utap demonstrate perform unit tests shiny utility functions testthat.

title: Unit Test Your Shiny App Package
text: don’t want install package, might want download example (read post learn ’s contents).

title: Unit Test Your Shiny App Package
code: #> R/ #> ├── nin.R #> ├── pull_binary_cols.R #> ├── pull_cat_cols.R #> ├── pull_facet_cols.R #> ├── pull_numeric_cols.R #> ├── select_by_class.R #> ├── testtthat.R #> └── utap-package.R

title: Unit Test Your Shiny App Package
code: #> tests/testthat/ #> ├── test-pull_binary_cols.R #> ├── test-pull_cat_cols.R #> ├── test-pull_facet_cols.R #> ├── test-pull_numeric_cols.R #> ├── test-select_by_class.R #> └── test-utils.R

title: Unit Test Your Shiny App Package
code: ==> devtools::test()  ℹ Testing utap ✔ | F W  S  OK | Context ✔ |         29 | pull_binary_cols ✔ |          4 | pull_cat_cols ✔ |         20 | pull_facet_cols ✔ |          5 | pull_numeric_cols ✔ |         25 | select_by_class ✔ |          3 | utils          ══ Results ═══════════════════ Duration: 2.0 s  [ FAIL 0 | WARN 0 | SKIP 0 | PASS 86 ]

title: Binary column maker — bin_maker
code: bin_maker(type = "log", size = 2) #> Error in bin_maker(type = "log", size = 2): unused argument (type = "log") bin_maker(type = "log", size = 2, missing = TRUE) #> Error in bin_maker(type = "log", size = 2, missing = TRUE): unused argument (type = "log") bin_maker(type = "int", size = 10) #> Error in bin_maker(type = "int", size = 10): unused argument (type = "int") bin_maker(type = "int", size = 10, missing = TRUE) #> Error in bin_maker(type = "int", size = 10, missing = TRUE): unused argument (type = "int") bin_maker(type = "chr", size = 10) #> Error in bin_maker(type = "chr", size = 10): unused argument (type = "chr") bin_maker(type = "chr", size = 10, missing = TRUE) #> Error in bin_maker(type = "chr", size = 10, missing = TRUE): unused argument (type = "chr") bin_maker(type = "fct", size = 10) #> Error in bin_maker(type = "fct", size = 10): unused argument (type = "fct") bin_maker(type = "fct", size = 10, missing = TRUE) #> Error in bin_maker(type = "fct", size = 10, missing = TRUE): unused argument (type = "fct") bin_maker(type = "ord", size = 10) #> Error in bin_maker(type = "ord", size = 10): unused argument (type = "ord") bin_maker(type = "ord", size = 10, missing = TRUE) #> Error in bin_maker(type = "ord", size = 10, missing = TRUE): unused argument (type = "ord")

title: Character column maker — chr_maker
code: chr_maker(size = 2, lvls = 2, TRUE) #> [1] "item: 1" NA        chr_maker(size = 2, lvls = 1, TRUE) #> [1] "item: 1" NA        chr_maker(size = 3, lvls = 3, FALSE) #> [1] "item:1" "item:2" "item:3" chr_maker(size = 3, lvls = 3, TRUE) #> [1] "item:1" "item:2" "item:1" chr_maker(size = 10, lvls = 6, TRUE) #>  [1] "item:1" "item:2" "item:3" "item:4" "item:5" "item:6" NA       "item:1" #>  [9] "item:2" "item:1"

title: Column maker — col_maker
text: Column maker

title: Column maker — col_maker
code: col_maker(col_types, size, missing, ...)

title: Column maker — col_maker
text: col_types column type size many rows? missing logical, include missing? ... additional arguments passed _maker functions

title: Column maker — col_maker
code: col_maker(col_types = c("log", "log", "dbl", "dbl", "fct", "ord", "chr"),   size = 6, missing = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   log_var log_2_var dbl_var dbl_2_var fct_var ord_var chr_var #>   <lgl>   <lgl>       <dbl>     <dbl> <fct>   <ord>   <chr>   #> 1 TRUE    TRUE         0.1       0.1  group 1 level 1 item:1  #> 2 FALSE   FALSE        0.68      0.68 group 2 level 2 item:2  #> 3 TRUE    TRUE         1.26      1.26 group 3 level 3 item:3  #> 4 FALSE   FALSE        1.84      1.84 group 1 level 1 item:1  #> 5 TRUE    TRUE         2.42      2.42 group 2 level 2 item:2  #> 6 FALSE   FALSE        3         3    group 3 level 3 item:3  col_maker(col_types = c("log", "log", "dbl", "dbl", "fct", "ord", "chr"),   size = 10, missing = TRUE, lvls = 4) #> # A tibble: 10 × 7 #>    log_var log_2_var dbl_var dbl_2_var fct_var ord_var chr_var #>    <lgl>   <lgl>       <dbl>     <dbl> <fct>   <ord>   <chr>   #>  1 TRUE    TRUE         0.1       0.1  group 1 level 1 item:1  #>  2 FALSE   FALSE        2.55      2.55 group 2 level 2 item:2  #>  3 NA      NA           5         5    group 3 level 3 item:3  #>  4 TRUE    TRUE        NA        NA    group 4 level 4 item:4  #>  5 FALSE   FALSE        0.1       0.1  NA      NA      NA      #>  6 NA      NA           2.55      2.55 group 1 level 1 item:1  #>  7 TRUE    TRUE         5         5    group 2 level 2 item:2  #>  8 FALSE   FALSE       NA        NA    group 3 level 3 item:3  #>  9 NA      NA           0.1       0.1  group 4 level 4 item:4  #> 10 TRUE    TRUE         2.55      2.55 NA      NA      item:1  col_maker(col_types = c("log", "log", "dbl", "dbl", "fct", "ord", "chr"),   size = 10, missing = TRUE, lvls = 2) #> # A tibble: 10 × 7 #>    log_var log_2_var dbl_var dbl_2_var fct_var ord_var chr_var #>    <lgl>   <lgl>       <dbl>     <dbl> <fct>   <ord>   <chr>   #>  1 TRUE    TRUE         0.1       0.1  group 1 level 1 item:1  #>  2 FALSE   FALSE        2.55      2.55 group 2 level 2 item:2  #>  3 NA      NA           5         5    NA      NA      NA      #>  4 TRUE    TRUE        NA        NA    group 1 level 1 item:1  #>  5 FALSE   FALSE        0.1       0.1  group 2 level 2 item:2  #>  6 NA      NA           2.55      2.55 NA      NA      NA      #>  7 TRUE    TRUE         5         5    group 1 level 1 item:1  #>  8 FALSE   FALSE       NA        NA    group 2 level 2 item:2  #>  9 NA      NA           0.1       0.1  NA      NA      NA      #> 10 TRUE    TRUE         2.55      2.55 group 1 level 1 item:1  col_maker(col_types = c("log", "log", "dbl", "dbl", "fct", "ord", "chr"),   size = 6, missing = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   log_var log_2_var dbl_var dbl_2_var fct_var ord_var chr_var #>   <lgl>   <lgl>       <dbl>     <dbl> <fct>   <ord>   <chr>   #> 1 TRUE    TRUE         0.1       0.1  group 1 level 1 item:1  #> 2 FALSE   FALSE        0.68      0.68 group 2 level 2 item:2  #> 3 TRUE    TRUE         1.26      1.26 group 3 level 3 item:3  #> 4 FALSE   FALSE        1.84      1.84 group 1 level 1 item:1  #> 5 TRUE    TRUE         2.42      2.42 group 2 level 2 item:2  #> 6 FALSE   FALSE        3         3    group 3 level 3 item:3

text: function designed quickly determine variables appropriate number categorical levels using ggplot2::facet_wrap() ggplot2::facet_grid()

title: Facet app inputs — pull_facet_cols
code: require(dplyr) require(NHANES) #> Loading required package: NHANES #> Warning: there is no package called ‘NHANES’ pull_facet_cols(df = dplyr::starwars) #>   sex  #> "sex"  pull_facet_cols(df = NHANES::NHANES) #> Error in purrr::map(.x = class, .f = col_class, df = df): ℹ In index: 1. #> Caused by error in `loadNamespace()`: #> ! there is no package called ‘NHANES’  str(dplyr::select(   dplyr::starwars,   dplyr::all_of(pull_facet_cols(df = dplyr::starwars)) )) #> tibble [87 × 1] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ sex: chr [1:87] "male" "none" "none" "male" ... str(dplyr::select(   NHANES::NHANES,   dplyr::all_of(pull_facet_cols(df = NHANES::NHANES)) )) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘NHANES’

title: Numeric app inputs — pull_numeric_cols
text: Numeric app inputs

title: Numeric app inputs — pull_numeric_cols
code: pull_numeric_cols(df)

title: Numeric app inputs — pull_numeric_cols
text: df data.frame tibble

title: Numeric app inputs — pull_numeric_cols
text: named character vector integer double column names

title: Numeric app inputs — pull_numeric_cols
code: require(palmerpenguins) #> Loading required package: palmerpenguins #> Warning: there is no package called ‘palmerpenguins’ require(dplyr) pull_numeric_cols(palmerpenguins::penguins) #> Error in purrr::map(.x = class, .f = col_class, df = df): ℹ In index: 1. #> Caused by error in `loadNamespace()`: #> ! there is no package called ‘palmerpenguins’ pull_numeric_cols(dplyr::starwars) #>         mass   birth_year       height  #>       "mass" "birth_year"     "height"

title: Get column types — select_by_class
text: Return column data types

title: Get column types — select_by_class
code: select_by_class(df, class, return_tbl = TRUE)

title: Get column types — select_by_class
text: df data.frame tibble return_tbl logical, return tibble (TRUE) named vector (FALSE) type type column return One : "log": logical "dbl": double "int": integer "chr": character "fct": factor "ord": factor (ordered) "list": list

title: Get column types — select_by_class
text: named vector tibble columns matching type (empty vector tibble columns specified type exist)

title: Get column types — select_by_class
code: select_by_class(dplyr::starwars, class = "chr") #> # A tibble: 87 × 8 #>    name           hair_color skin_color eye_color sex   gender homeworld species #>    <chr>          <chr>      <chr>      <chr>     <chr> <chr>  <chr>     <chr>   #>  1 Luke Skywalker blond      fair       blue      male  mascu… Tatooine  Human   #>  2 C-3PO          NA         gold       yellow    none  mascu… Tatooine  Droid   #>  3 R2-D2          NA         white, bl… red       none  mascu… Naboo     Droid   #>  4 Darth Vader    none       white      yellow    male  mascu… Tatooine  Human   #>  5 Leia Organa    brown      light      brown     fema… femin… Alderaan  Human   #>  6 Owen Lars      brown, gr… light      blue      male  mascu… Tatooine  Human   #>  7 Beru Whitesun… brown      light      blue      fema… femin… Tatooine  Human   #>  8 R5-D4          NA         white, red red       none  mascu… Tatooine  Droid   #>  9 Biggs Darklig… black      light      brown     male  mascu… Tatooine  Human   #> 10 Obi-Wan Kenobi auburn, w… fair       blue-gray male  mascu… Stewjon   Human   #> # ℹ 77 more rows select_by_class(dplyr::starwars, class = "chr", return_tbl = FALSE) #>         name   hair_color   skin_color    eye_color          sex       gender  #>       "name" "hair_color" "skin_color"  "eye_color"        "sex"     "gender"  #>    homeworld      species  #>  "homeworld"    "species"  select_by_class(dplyr::starwars, class = "list") #> # A tibble: 87 × 3 #>    films     vehicles  starships #>    <list>    <list>    <list>    #>  1 <chr [5]> <chr [2]> <chr [2]> #>  2 <chr [6]> <chr [0]> <chr [0]> #>  3 <chr [7]> <chr [0]> <chr [0]> #>  4 <chr [4]> <chr [0]> <chr [1]> #>  5 <chr [5]> <chr [1]> <chr [0]> #>  6 <chr [3]> <chr [0]> <chr [0]> #>  7 <chr [3]> <chr [0]> <chr [0]> #>  8 <chr [1]> <chr [0]> <chr [0]> #>  9 <chr [1]> <chr [0]> <chr [1]> #> 10 <chr [6]> <chr [1]> <chr [5]> #> # ℹ 77 more rows select_by_class(dplyr::starwars, class = "list", return_tbl = FALSE) #>       films    vehicles   starships  #>     "films"  "vehicles" "starships"  select_by_class(tidyr::fish_encounters, "chr") #> #
